oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Statler Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of the Statler Brothers (musical group). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Statler Brothers; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Flowers on the Wall [excerpt] [featuring the Statler Brothers introduction radio spot voiceover) -- (00:37) Hallmarks of Country Music introduction tune [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:47) Thank You World (Statler Brother) -- (04:46) Phillips introduces the Statler Brothers and each discuss why the Statler Brother chose to stay in Staunton, Virginia; additionally, "Do You Remember These" is said to be constructed from a word list -- (09:25) Do You Remember These (Statler Brother) -- (12:10) V. D. commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (12:40) Phillips performs a vehicle safety radio spot -- (13:45) Class of '57 (Statler Brother) -- (16:16) Phillips questions the nostalgia of "Class of '57," and Phillips and the Statler Brothers reflect on "What Ever Happened to Randolph Scott" -- (20:11) What Ever Happened to Randolph Scott (Statler Brother) -- (21:58) Anti-shoplifting commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (22:29) Anti-smoking commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (23:34) Monday Morning Secretary (Statler Brother) -- (26:04) Phillips and the Statler Brothers reflect on how "Monday Morning Secretary" is a tribute to secretaries, and the Statler Brothers reflect on recording all their own work -- (31:05) This Bed of Roses (Statler Brother) -- (33:29) U. S. O. radio spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (34:34) Flowers on the Wall (Statler Brother) -- (36:46) The Statler Brothers attribute "Flowers on the Wall" to their success; additionally, Phillips inquires about the Statler Brothers' Most Promising Comedy Award -- (41:27) Phillips plays a tape of Lester "Roadhog" Moran and His Cadillac Cowboys -- (43:03) Why Baby Why [excerpt] (Lester "Roadhog" Moran and His Cadillac Cowboys) -- (45:00) Folsom Prison Blues (Lester "Roadhog" Moran and His Cadillac Cowboys) -- (46:04) Savings bonds commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (46:34) Susan When She Tried (Statler Brother) -- (49:28) Phillips performs a G. I. Bill radio spot -- (50:00) A black history commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (50:58) Don Reid reflects on Sons of the Motherland, and Phillips and the Statler Brothers say their goodbyes -- (52:17) Veteran's benefits commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (53:00) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (55:07) Phillips introduces next weeks guest Jean Shepard -- (55:17) Slippin' Away (Jean Shepard) -- (57:29) Shepard and Phillips reflect on Shepard's vocal qualities -- (59:05) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Statler Brothers; Phillips, Rick;
